title: What time is The Circle on Channel 4 tonight and what’s the latest twist?
text:
Will Jack’s stay in The Circle be over on Sunday night? (Picture: Channel 4)

The action is really hotting up in The Circle as players continue to arrive – and leave – the apartment block in the Channel 4 series.

In recent days we’ve seen the departure of Jay, aka Katie – as well as newcomers Jack, Beth and Paddy make their debuts on the show.

Now, after a Saturday night break the series returned for its latest instalment – and this time it’s got a killer twist in store.

So what time should you tune in – and what’s the twist all about?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time is The Circle on Channel 4 tonight?

The Circle picks up where it left off on Channel 4 at 10pm on Sunday night.

Jay, aka Katie, became the latest player to be blocked at the end of last week (Picture: Channel 4)

The show runs for an hour tonight and is on every night this week at 10pm except on Tuesdays when it’s at the slightly later time of 10.15pm.

Although it’s proving popular the show’s late hour has left some viewers disgruntled at having to stay up until 11pm or later to catch the action from the block.

Don’t worry though, you can always catch up on 4od if you really can’t stay up that late.

What’s the latest twist in The Circle?

Ryan and Lauren could be sent in to shake things up (Picture: Channel 4)

The newest twist was revealed by Emma Willis on Friday evening’s live show.

After Jack and Beth found themselves at the bottom of the ratings – potentially facing being blocked from the show – viewers were given the choice to either vote for Jack and Beth to team up and catfish the others as 62-year-old Joyce – or for the pair to be blocked and for a new couple, Ryan and Lauren, to be brought in.

As an added twist those two would play solely under Ryan’s profile – thus catfishing the rest of the contestants – while Jack and Beth would be blocked.

In the event that a couple wins the show, the £100,000 prize would be split between them.

description: The Circle kicks off a new week of action on Channel 4 with a killer twist but what time should you tune in?
